net.akami.mask.core

Class Mask

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.akami.mask.core.Mask

  • public class Mask
extends java.lang.Object
    Mutable object representing a raw mathematical expression as a string, without any extra information.
    Masks are used by a MaskOperatorHandler as containers for string results.
    The Mask class is different from the Expression class. A Mask is a simple object handling a string that can be changed through operations, whereas an Expression is an immutable data class containing the whole mathematical translation of the string. Expressions are exclusively used along with the binary tree algorithm, for calculations.
    Masks can be created without initial value (String). Modifications are performed through reload(String).

    Whenever an expression is defined for the current mask, validity checks are performed. They ensure that the given expression is valid mathwise. ValidityCheck are defined in the MaskContext the mask belongs to.
    Author:
    Antoine Tran

    • Field Detail

      • TEMP

        public static final Mask TEMP
        Temporary instance that can be used whenever you perform operations, and don't need the result to be stored inside a Mask. This is useful if you just want to retrieve the result of a given operation. It allows multiple instances avoidance.
        Example : 
         
 Mask curve = new Mask("x^2 + 3x + 4");
 MaskOperatorHandler handler = MaskOperatorHandler.DEFAULT;
 // Value already set to true by default, if not changed
 handler.setCurrentToOut(true);
 String derivative = handler.compute(MaskDerivativeCalculator.class, curve, Mask.TEMP, 'x')
         .asExpression();

 System.out.println(derivative);
        Output : 2.0x + 3.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mask

        public Mask()
        Constructs a new Mask without any string expression by default, and without any specified context. MaskContext.DEFAULT will be used.

    • Method Detail

      • getExpression

        public java.lang.String getExpression()
        Returns:
        the mathematical expression that the mask handles

      • reload

        public void reload(java.lang.String newExp)
        Reloads the mask with the given expression. If null, the new expression will be "undefined".
        Validity checks are also performed through reload.
        Parameters:
        newExp - the new expression for the mask

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the expression of the mask
